question: What is the purpose of an amethyst block when placed adjacent to a sculk sensor or a calibrated sculk sensor in Minecraft and What is the recommended platform for reporting issues related to the "Block of Amethyst" in the Bedrock Edition of Minecraft?
answer: In Minecraft, when an amethyst block is placed adjacent to a sculk sensor or a calibrated sculk sensor, it plays a crucial role in wireless signal transmission. The sculk sensor receives a vibration, which is then re-emitted as a separate vibration by the amethyst block at its location. This vibration can be detected by another sculk sensor, allowing the creation of a chain of sculk sensors and amethyst blocks to transmit a signal wirelessly. This feature enables the transmission of information over long distances without the need for physical connections, making it an essential component in various Minecraft builds and contraptions. According to the Bedrock Edition documentation, it is recommended to report issues related to the "Block of Amethyst" on the bug tracker, specifically on the page dedicated to issues relating to this topic.

Context: Spawn Egg – Minecraft WikiSpawn Egg(Redirected from Spawn Bee)Jump to navigationJump to searchThis article is about mob spawn eggs.  For the object in Minecraft: Story Mode, see Story Mode:Spawn Egg.  For other uses, see Egg (disambiguation).  It has been suggested that  this page be split. [discuss]If this split may potentially be controversial, do not split until a consensus has been reached. Reason: This page addresses close to a hundred distinct items, and the ID, history, etc. sections are a complete mess as a result. We already split Music Disc into one item per page - can the same logic be applied here? Only generic information about spawn eggs would remain on this page, with specific details per egg (ID, sprite (especially given recent changes), sound events, history) being documented on the split pages.Spawn Egg[note 1]View all iconsRarity tierCommonRenewableNoStackableYes (64), the same type of spawn egg only{    "extratext": "[[#Icons|View all icons]]",    "title": "Spawn Egg",    "images": [        "Creeper Spawn Egg JE3 BE2.png"    ],    "rows": [        {            "field": "Common",            "label": "(link to Rarity article, displayed as Rarity tier)"        },        {            "field": "No",            "label": "(link to Renewable resource article, displayed as Renewable)"        },        {            "field": "Yes (64), the same type of spawn egg only",            "label": "Stackable"        }    ],    "invimages": [        "Creeper Spawn Egg"    ]}A spawn egg is an item used to spawn mobs directly.Contents1 Obtaining2 Usage2.1 Dispensers2.2 Baby mobs2.3 Monster spawners2.4 Renaming2.5 Survival mode3 List of spawn eggs3.1 Mobs without spawn eggs3.2 Removed spawn eggs4 Sounds5 Data values5.1 ID5.2 Item data6 History6.1 Data history7 Issues8 Gallery8.1 Icons8.2 Screenshots8.3 Mojang screenshots8.4 In other media9 Notes10 References11 External links12 NavigationObtaining[edit | edit source]Spawn eggs can be obtained only in Creative mode or using commands. In Creative mode, the player can press pick block on an existing mob to obtain their respective egg. In Bedrock Edition, spawn eggs are found at the bottom of the Nature tab of the Creative inventory, whereas they have their own tab in Java Edition. There are 83 spawn eggs in Bedrock Edition and 81 spawn eggs in Java Edition.Usage[edit | edit source]A spawn egg is used by pressing use on any surface (top, bottom, or side) with the egg. When used on a top surface, the egg's mob appears with its feet immediately adjacent to the surface, and its ambient sound is played.Spawn eggs are not thrown (unlike normal eggs); the player must be within normal range of the block to use the spawn egg. All monster mobs (except shulkers, piglins, hoglins and ender dragons; in Bedrock Edition, also piglin brutes) spawned while on Peaceful difficulty get created and immediately deleted from the world.The surfaces of blocks are prioritized for spawning; if none are within reach, mobs can also be spawned in water or lava sources.Dispensers[edit | edit source]A spawn egg fired from a dispenser spawns the mob directly in front of the dispenser. The spawn egg is consumed when fired.Baby mobs[edit | edit source]If the player uses a spawn egg on the type of mob it spawns, and that mob has a baby form, the egg spawns a baby version of the mob. For instance, using a sheep spawn egg on a sheep makes a baby sheep with the same wool color.Monster spawners[edit | edit source]All spawn eggs can also be used on a monster spawner or trial spawner to change the mob that spawns. In Bedrock Edition, spawn eggs for any of the fish mobs spawn them only if the monster spawner is waterlogged.Renaming[edit | edit source]A spawn egg can be renamed on an anvil, and when used it spawns a mob with that name appearing over its head. The name can be seen only by aiming at the mob from four or fewer blocks away. This name also appears in death messages from the mob killing a player. If the player renames a spawn egg by the names described below, the mob appears described below. If the player renames a rabbit spawn egg "Toast", the secret skin of the rabbit appears when the egg is used. Naming a spawn egg "Dinnerbone" or "Grumm" causes the mob to appear upside down and show the given name above it. Renaming a vindicator "Johnny" causes it to act hostile to all mobs except for other illagers. Renaming a sheep "jeb_" makes the sheep's wool color cycle in a rainbow loop. This doesn't change the color of the wool the sheep drops. Renaming a spawn egg of a hostile mob with an anvil and then spawning the hostile mob with the renamed spawn egg does not prevent the hostile mob from despawning, unlike using a name tag on the mob.Survival mode[edit | edit source]Players in Survival mode can use spawn eggs normally, though spawn eggs are not obtainable in Survival. They can be obtained only using the Creative menu or commands. Unlike in Creative, spawn eggs are consumed when used in Survival mode.List of spawn eggs[edit | edit source]There is a spawn egg for almost every mob in the game; exceptions are listed below this table.EggSpawnsNotesHostile mobs Blaze BoggedBogged may spawn with an enchanted bow and armor. Breeze CreakingCreakings spawned with a spawn egg aren’t protected by a creaking heart, and die in just one hit. CreeperCreepers can never spawn charged. Elder Guardian Ender DragonAccessible only via commands to prevent accidental destruction of player builds.[1] Endermite EvokerIn Java Edition, evokers have a chance to spawn as a raid captain. Ghast Guardian HoglinHoglins have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. HuskHusks have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. In Java Edition, baby husks have a 5% chance to spawn as a chicken jockey. In Bedrock Edition, a baby husk has a 15% chance to find a mount, becoming a jockey. There is also a chance of them holding tools, weapons or armor. Magma CubeMagma cubes spawn with a random size. Phantom Piglin BrutePiglin brutes may spawn with an enchanted axe. Piglin brutes never spawn with armor. PillagerPillagers may spawn with an enchanted crossbow. In Java Edition, they also have a chance to spawn as a raid captain. RavagerRavagers never spawn being ridden by illagers. ShulkerShulkers spawn undyed. Their orientation is also dependent on where the shulker is placed. Silverfish SkeletonSkeletons may spawn with an enchanted bow and armor. SlimeSlimes spawn with a random size. StrayStrays may spawn with an enchanted bow and armor. VexHas a chance to spawn with an enchanted sword. VindicatorVindicators may spawn with an enchanted axe. In Java Edition, they also have a chance to spawn as a raid captain. Warden Witch WitherAccessible only via commands to prevent accidental destruction of player builds. Wither Skeleton Zoglin ZombieZombies do not spawn as zombie villagers, but they have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. There is also a chance of them holding tools, weapons or armor. In Java Edition, a baby zombie has a 5% chance to spawn as a chicken jockey. In Bedrock Edition, a baby zombie has a 15% chance to find a mount, becoming a jockey.Zombie VillagerZombie villagers' professions are randomized. Their outfit depends on the biome, and they have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. In Java Edition, a baby zombie villager has a 5% chance to spawn as a chicken jockey. In Bedrock Edition, a baby zombie villager has a 15% chance to find a mount, becoming a jockey.Neutral mobs BeeBees have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. Cave SpiderIn Bedrock Edition, cave spiders have a 1% chance to spawn as a spider jockey. DolphinDolphins have a 10% chance to spawn as a baby.DrownedDrowned can spawn holding tridents, fishing rods, or nautilus shells. Drowned have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. In Java Edition, a baby drowned has a 5% chance to spawn as a chicken jockey. EndermanEndermen spawn neutral and not holding a block. FoxFoxes spawn untrusting, and as either regular or snowy depending on the biome. They can spawn holding items and have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. GoatGoats spawn with two horns and have a 5% chance spawning as a baby, and a 2% chance to spawn as a screaming goat. Iron GolemThese golems are neutral like the village golems. LlamaLlamas spawn untamed and their color is randomized. They have a 10% chance to spawn as a baby. PandaPandas spawn with a random personality and have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. PiglinPiglins have a 25%‌[JE  only] or 5%‌[BE  only] chance to spawn as a baby. They have an equal (50/50) chance to spawn with either a crossbow or golden sword, which may be enchanted. They may also spawn with enchanted golden armor. Polar BearPolar bears have a 10% chance to spawn as a baby. SpiderSpiders have a 1% chance to spawn as a spider jockey. Trader LlamaTrader llamas spawn untamed and their color is randomized. WolfWolves spawn untamed and neutral, and their skins are biome-dependent. They have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. Zombified PiglinZombified piglins spawn neutral and have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. In Java Edition, a baby zombified piglin has a 5% chance to spawn as a chicken jockey. They may also spawn with an enchanted sword.Passive mobs Agent‌[BE & edu  only]Agent spawned by its spawn egg is not visible or interactable in Bedrock Edition. Allay Armadillo AxolotlAxolotls' color is randomized and have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. BatIf the player is far enough away when using the spawn egg on the bottom of an opaque block, the bat hangs upside down from it. Camel CatCats' skins are randomized and always spawn stray cats. Cats have a 25% chance to spawn as a baby. ChickenChickens have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. Chickens are temperate, warm, or cold depending on the biome. Cod CowCows have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. Cows are temperate, warm, or cold depending on the biome. DonkeyDonkeys spawn untamed and have a 20% chance to spawn as a baby. FrogFrog skins are biome-dependent. Glow SquidGlow squids have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. Happy GhastHappy ghasts spawn without a harness. HorseHorses spawn untamed and their skins are randomized. They have a 20% chance to spawn as a baby. MooshroomMooshrooms always spawn red and have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. MuleMules have a 20% chance to spawn as a baby.NPC‌[BE & edu  only]NPCs always spawn with the first default skin. OcelotOcelots spawn untrusting.1⁄7 of the time (14.3%), an ocelot spawns with two ocelot kittens. ParrotParrots spawn untamed and their color is randomized. PigPigs spawn without a saddle and have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. Pigs are temperate, warm, or cold depending on the biome. Pufferfish RabbitRabbit skins are random and biome-dependent. The black-and-white rabbit spawns only if the spawn egg is renamed Toast. Rabbits have a 25% chance to spawn as a baby. SalmonSalmon spawn with a random size. SheepSheep spawn with the colors that can appear naturally; see Sheep § Spawning for details. Sheep have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. Skeleton HorseSkeleton horses have a 20% chance to spawn as a baby and never spawn as a skeleton trap. SnifferBaby sniffers are also spawned from the sniffer egg. Snow GolemSnow golems can never spawn sheared. SquidSquids have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. StriderStriders have a 1⁄10 chance to spawn ridden by a baby strider and a 1⁄30 chance to spawn wearing a saddle and ridden by a zombified piglin. TadpoleAlso spawned from frogspawn. Tropical FishShapes, colors, and patterns are randomized, although 90% of the time the tropical fish spawn as one of the 22 uniquely-named variants. TurtleTurtles have a 10% chance to spawn as a baby. Baby turtles are also spawned from the turtle egg. VillagerIn Java Edition, villagers spawn unemployed; in Bedrock Edition, their professions are randomized.[2]. Their outfit is biome-dependent. They have a 5% chance to spawn as a baby. Wandering TraderIn Bedrock Edition, wandering traders always spawn with two leashed trader llamas. Zombie HorseZombie horses have a 20% chance to spawn as a baby. Mobs without spawn eggs[edit | edit source]The following mobs do not have explicitly defined spawn eggs. Custom spawn eggs can be created with a custom NBT tag that changes the spawned entity, however no spawn egg explicitly associated with any of the mobs exist.MobReasonVariantsBrown MooshroomShares ID with red variantKiller BunnyShares ID with normal variantOther mobsGiantUnused[3]Elder Guardian GhostUnusedIllusionerUnused[4]Old VillagerUnusedOld Zombie VillagerUnusedRemoved spawn eggs[edit | edit Must include id tag.Bedrock Edition:In Bedrock Edition, spawn eggs have no additional tags.See also: Bedrock Edition level format/Item formatHistory[edit | edit source]For information on the historical colors of spawn eggs, see Spawn Egg colors § History.  This section is missing information about: Bedrock Edition being outdated25w15a changed some of the Programmer Art textures - show before and afterHow did the blaze and breeze spawn eggs change in 25w15a?. Please expand the section to include this information. Further details may exist on the talk page.Java Edition1.111w49a                    Added spawn eggs for creepers, skeletons, spiders, zombies, slimes, ghasts, pig zombies, endermen, cave spiders, silverfish, blazes, magma cubes, pigs, sheep, cows, chickens, squid, wolves, mooshrooms and villagers. The spawn egg has a single texture file, which is tinted different colors.12w01a                    The spawn egg and its markings now have their textures separated, allowing them to have entirely different colors. This allows their colors to better match the colors of the mobs themselves.1.2.112w03aSpawn eggs can now be placed into a dispenser. Activating the dispenser spawns the mob, instead of dispensing the egg as an item.Spawn eggs are now stackable.12w04a Added ocelot spawn eggs with the addition of the ocelot itself.Before 1.2, edited spawn eggs for snow golems, ender dragons and giants (and other "unspawnable" mobs) produced mobs of their types. Now, this is restricted to those eggs available in the creative inventory.1.3.112w18aVillagers spawned from spawn eggs were always farmers before this update, now their professions are randomized.1.4.212w32aZombie villagers can now be spawned using zombie spawn eggs.Sheep from spawn eggs can now spawn naturally-colored sheep (white, gray, brown, pink, etc.).12w36aWither skeletons now have a high chance to spawn from skeleton spawn eggs when used in the Nether.Skeletons on spider jockeys can now be replaced with wither skeletons when using spider spawn eggs in the Nether.12w38a  Added witch and bat spawn eggs.1.4.4preBaby mobs are now spawn-able by right-clicking a mob with a corresponding mob egg. Unlike other mobs, this does not work with zombies and zombie pigmen.1.5January 7, 2013Dinnerbone tweeted the first image of a renamed mob appearing in a death message.13w02aMobs spawned from renamed eggs now have the name of the egg and the names appear in death messages.Mobs can now display their custom name as nametag using an NBT tag.1.6.113w16a Added horse spawn eggs.13w24aSpawn eggs now work on water.1.6Renaming a spawn egg "Dinnerbone" or "Grumm" now cause the mob to spawn upside-down.1.7.413w48bRenaming a sheep or sheep spawn egg "jeb_" give it a rainbow wool changing effect. This does not affect the wool dropped after death or shearing, however.1.814w11a Added endermite spawn eggs.14w25a Added guardian spawn eggs.14w27a Added rabbit spawn eggs.14w28bSpawn eggs can now be used to program monster spawner blocks.1.915w31a Added shulker spawn eggs.1.1016w20a          Added spawn eggs for polar bears, wither skeletons, strays, husks, elder guardian, cats, donkeys, mules, skeleton horses and zombie horses.pre2Removed all spawn eggs added in 16w20a except for the polar bear spawn egg.1.1116w32a        Re-added the spawn eggs that were removed in 1.10-pre2, except the cat spawn egg. Added zombie villager spawn eggs. It can spawn only zombie farmers.Using a spawn egg by aiming at the top face of a block now always spawns the mob on the ground. This prevents it from spawning too high on non-full blocks such as slabs or soul sand and prevents it from falling through fences.[5]Spawn eggs can no longer randomly spawn other variants of that mob, instead their own spawn egg must be used. This means that horse spawn eggs no longer have a chance to spawn donkeys, skeleton spawn eggs no longer have a chance to spawn wither skeletons in the Nether or strays in cold biomes and zombie spawn eggs no longer have a chance to spawn husks in desert biomes or randomly spawn zombie villagers.Spawn Eggs are now sorted alphabetically in the creative inventory. Prior to this they were sorted by the entity IDs of the corresponding mobs.16w32bThe zombie villager spawn egg now spawns different zombie professions.16w39a    Added spawn eggs for evokers, llamas, vexes and vindicators.1.1217w13a Added parrot spawn eggs.1.1317w47aUsing a spawn egg on a block without collision now spawns the mob inside of that block instead of next to it.18w07a  Added phantom and turtle spawn eggs.18w08b   Added spawn eggs for the 3 fish mob variants: cod, salmon, and pufferfish.18w10a Added tropical fish spawn eggs.18w11a Added drowned spawn eggs.18w15a Added dolphin spawn eggs.18w19a The phantom spawn egg has been changed to look more like the updated phantom texture.18w20a"Spawn <Mob>" has been changed to "<Mob> Spawn Egg".1.1418w43a   Added spawn eggs for pandas, pillagers and "illager beasts".18w44a Re-added cat spawn eggs.19w05aThe "illager beast" spawn egg has been renamed to "ravager" spawn egg.  Added wandering trader and trader llama spawn eggs.19w07a Added fox spawn eggs.1.1519w34a Added bee spawn eggs.19w37aUsing an ocelot spawn egg no longer has a chance ​[more information needed] to spawn 2 baby ocelots in addition to an adult ocelot.[6]Horse, donkey, mule, skeleton horse, zombie horse llama, trader llama spawn eggs no longer have a random chance to spawn baby mobs when not used on that type of mob.[7]19w41a The texture of the bee spawn egg has been changed.19w46aDrowned, husk, zombie, and zombie villager spawn eggs can now be used on these mobs to spawn their baby variant.Pre-release 1Zombie pigmen spawn eggs can now be used on zombie pigmen to spawn their baby variant.September 28, 2019  Hoglin and piglin spawn eggs were shown.1.1620w06a Added hoglin spawn eggs.Currently, the hoglin spawn egg substitutes the zombie pigman's spawn egg texture.20w07a Added piglin spawn eggs. The texture of the hoglin spawn egg has been changed.20w09a"Zombie Pigman Spawn Egg" has been renamed to "Zombified Piglin Spawn Egg".20w13a Added strider spawn eggs.20w14a Added zoglin spawn eggs.1.16.220w27a Added piglin brute spawn eggs.October 6, 2020 Kingbdogz showed a warden spawn egg.1.1720w51a Added axolotl spawn eggs.21w03a Added glow squid spawn eggs.21w13a Added goat spawn eggs.October 16, 2021  Frog and tadpole spawn eggs were shown.1.19Deep Dark Experimental Snapshot 1 Added warden spawn eggs.22w11a Added frog and tadpole spawn eggs.As with the warden itself, warden spawn eggs are not added in this snapshot.22w12a Re-added warden spawn eggs.22w13a Added allay spawn eggs.1.19.3ExperimentUpdate 1.2022w42a Added camel spawn eggs behind the "Update 1.20" experimental data pack.22w43a The texture of the camel spawn egg has been changed.1.19.322w44a    Reimplemented iron golem, snow golem, wither and ender dragon spawn eggs. The wither and ender dragon spawn eggs are available only through commands to prevent accidental destruction of Creative builds. The texture of the polar bear spawn egg has been changed.[8]22w46aIron golem, snow golem, wither and ender dragon spawn eggs from before the Flattening are now converted to the newly reimplemented spawn eggs.[9] Previously, they would convert to pig spawn eggs with extra NBT.1.19.4ExperimentUpdate 1.2023w07a Added sniffer spawn eggs behind the "Update 1.20" experimental data pack.1.19.4-pre1 The texture of the sniffer spawn egg has been changed.1.2023w12aCamel and sniffer spawn eggs are now available without using the "Update 1.20" experimental data pack.1.20.3ExperimentUpdate 1.2123w45a Added breeze spawn eggs behind the "Update 1.21" experimental data pack.1.20.523w51a Added armadillo spawn eggs.24w03a Changed the texture of armadillo spawn eggs.1.20.5ExperimentUpdate 1.2124w07a Added bogged spawn eggs.1.20.524w10aIron golem and snow golem spawn eggs from before 1.13 no longer upgrade correctly as they did in 1.19.3.[10]1.2124w19aIron golem and snow golem spawn eggs from before 1.13 once again upgrade correctly as they did in 1.19.3.1.21.2ExperimentWinter Drop24w40a Added creaking spawn eggs.1.21.4Pre-Release 1Similar to block items, spawn eggs for entities that could execute operator-only commands now have a warning in tooltip.1.21.525w08a The texture of all spawn eggs has been changed.Pre-Release 1Spawn eggs now use their old textures if the Programmer Art resource pack is enabled.Upcoming Java EditionMarch 22, 2025 Happy ghast spawn eggs are revealed at Minecraft LIVE – March 2025.1.21.625w15a Added happy ghast spawn eggs.  Blaze and breeze egg size changed from "large" to "medium". Two miscolored pixels on the mooshroom spawn egg have been changed.Pocket Edition Alphav0.7.0    Added spawn eggs for chickens, sheep, pigs and cows.Due to MCPE-4935, it is possible to obtain a spawn egg labeled Spawn .name< by firing a bow and quickly switching to a regular spawn egg in the hotbar.v0.8.0build 1The texture of the default spawn egg is now , instead of having a completely blank texture.v0.9.0build 1          Added more spawn eggs, including mooshroom, creeper, enderman, silverfish, skeleton, slime, spider, zombie, zombie pigman and wolf.Spawn eggs now have the correct name in the inventory.build 2 Added (Old) villager spawn eggs.Spawn eggs can now be used to program monster spawner blocks.v0.11.0build 1It is no longer possible to obtain invalid spawn eggs via MCPE-4935.  Added squid and bat spawn eggs.   Added ghast, magma cube and cave spider spawn eggs, which are currently unobtainable.build 3Added cave spider spawn eggs to the creative mode inventory.build 8Added magma cube spawn eggs to the creative mode inventory.v0.12.1build 1   Added blaze, ocelot, and (Old) zombie villager spawn eggs.Added ghast spawn eggs to the creative mode inventory.Wither skeletons now have a high chance to spawn from an skeleton spawn egg, if the player is in the Nether.build 9Mobs spawned from renamed eggs now have the name of the egg and the names appear in death messages.build 12Zombie villagers can now be spawned using zombie spawn eggs.v0.13.0build 1 Added rabbit spawn eggs.v0.14.0build 1 Added witch spawn eggs.v0.14.2 Added tripod camera spawn eggs.v0.15.0build 1        Added horse, mule, donkey, zombie horse, skeleton horse, stray, husk and wither skeleton spawn eggs to the creative inventory.v0.15.1build 1The texture of the default spawn egg has been changed from  to .The empty spawn egg named "Spawn" is now available through inventory editing, but crashes the game.​[more information needed]v0.16.0build 1 Added guardian spawn eggs. Added elder guardian spawn egg without colors, which is currently unavailable in the creative inventory. question: {question} and What happens when a player uses a spawn egg on a mob that has a baby form, if the egg is of the same type as the mob?
answer: {answer} If the mob has a baby form, the egg will spawn a baby version of the mob, with the same characteristics as the adult mob.

source]brigadier:bool[edit | edit source]Must be a [Boolean]Boolean (either true or false).Official examplestruefalsebrigadier:double[edit | edit source]Must be a [Double]Double-precision floating-point number (from -(2-2-52)×21023 (≈-1.8×10308) to (2-2-52)×21023 (≈1.8×10308) ).Each double argument may have a custom minimum and maximum value.Precision varies throughout number line; the maximum absolute value is about 1.8×10308.Official examples01.2.5-1-.5-1234.56JSON properties in command syntax output[NBT Compound / JSON Object] properties: The root properties object.[Double] max: The maximum value of this double argument.[Double] min: The minimum value of this double argument.brigadier:float[edit | edit source]Must be a [Float]Single-precision floating-point number (from -(2-2-23)×2127 (≈-3.4×1038) to (2-2-23)2×127 (≈3.4×1038) ).Each float argument type may have a custom minimum and maximum value.Precision varies throughout number line; the maximum absolute value is about 3.4×1038.Official examples01.2.5-1-.5-1234.56JSON properties in command syntax output[NBT Compound / JSON Object] properties: The root properties object.[Float] max: The maximum value of this float argument.[Float] min: The minimum value of this float argument.brigadier:integer[edit | edit source]Must be a [Int]32-bit integer number (from -2147483648 (-231) to 2147483647 (231-1) ).Each integer argument type may have a custom minimum and maximum value.Maximum range is from −(231) to (231 − 1), or from (−2,147,483,648) to (2,147,483,647).Official examples0123-123JSON properties in command syntax output[NBT Compound / JSON Object] properties: The root properties object.[Int] max: The maximum value of this integer argument.[Int] min: The minimum value of this integer argument.brigadier:long[edit | edit source]Must be a [Long] 64-bit long (from -9223372036854775808 (-263) to 9223372036854775807 (263-1) ).Note: Although a long argument type is present in brigadier, it is not used by Minecraft.Each long argument type may have a custom minimum and maximum value.Maximum range is from −(263) to (263−1), or from (−9,223,372,036,854,775,808) to (9,223,372,036,854,775,807).Official examples0123-123JSON properties in command syntax output[NBT Compound / JSON Object] properties: The root properties object.[Long] max: The maximum value of this long argument.[Long] min: The minimum value of this long argument.brigadier:string[edit | edit source]Must be a string.Each string argument type can accept either a single word (no spaces), a quotable phrase (either single word or quoted string), or a greedy phrase (taking the rest of the command as the string argument).Official examplesSingle wordwordword_with_underscoresQuotable phrase"quoted phrase"word""Greedy phrasewordwords with spaces"and symbols"JSON properties in command syntax output[NBT Compound / JSON Object] properties: The root properties object.[String] type: The type of this string argument. Can be word, phrase, or greedyminecraft:angle[edit | edit source]Must be a yaw angle, measured in degrees with single-precision floating-point numbers. -180.0 for due north, -90.0 for due east, 0.0 for due south, 90.0 for due west, to 179.9 for just west of due north, before wrapping back around to -180.0. Tilde notation can be used to specify a rotation relative to the execution yaw rotation.Official examples0~~-0.5minecraft:block_pos[edit | edit source]Must be a block position composed of <X>, <Y> and <Z>, each of which must be an integer or a tilde and caret notation.Official examples0 0 0~ ~ ~^ ^ ^^1 ^ ^-5~0.5 ~1 ~-5minecraft:block_predicate[edit | edit source]The format of block_predicate parameters is block_id[block_states]{data_tags}, in which block states and data tags can be omitted when they are not needed.block_id is required, and it should be in the format of resource location(if namespace isn't set it defaults to minecraft:).It can also be the resource location of a block tag prefixed with #, such as #minecraft:planks.Block states are inside [], comma-separated and properties and values must be supported by the block or all blocks in the tag. They are optional.minecraft:stone[doesntexist=purpleberry] is unparseable, because stone doesn't have doesntexist.minecraft:redstone_wire[power=tuesday] is unparseable, because redstone_wire's power is a number between 0 and 15.Data tags are inside {}. They are optional.When test for block, only the states provided are tested.If a command tests for redstone_wire[power=15], it checks only power, but ignores other states such as north.Official examplesstoneminecraft:stonestone[foo=bar]#stone#stone[foo=bar]{baz:nbt}minecraft:block_state[edit | edit source]The format of block_state parameters is block_id[block_states]{data_tags}, in which block states and data tags can be omitted when they are not needed.block_id is required, and it should be in the format of resource location (if namespace isn't set it defaults to minecraft:).Block states are inside [], comma-separated and must be properties/values supported by the blocks. They are optional.minecraft:stone[doesntexist=purpleberry] is unparseable, because stone doesn't have doesntexist.minecraft:redstone_wire[power=tuesday] is unparseable, because redstone_wire's power is a number between 0 and 15.Data tags are inside {}. They are optional.When placing blocks, any states provided are set, but anything omitted retain their default values, depending on the block type.If a command sets redstone_wire[power=15], it is set power to 15, but north is a default value (in this case, set to none).Official examplesstoneminecraft:stonestone[foo=bar]foo{bar:baz}minecraft:color[edit | edit source]Must be a team color (reset or one of the 16 chat colors.)Official examplesredgreenminecraft:column_pos[edit | edit source]Must be a column coordinates composed of <X> and <Z>, each of which must be an integer or tilde notation.Official examples0 0~ ~~1 ~-2minecraft:component[edit | edit source]It must be a valid text component.Official examples"hello world"""{"text":"hello world"} [""]minecraft:dimension[edit | edit source]It must be a resource location, which resolves into a dimension during command execution.Official examplesminecraft:overworldminecraft:the_netherminecraft:entity[edit | edit source]Must be a player name, a target selector or a UUID.Each entity argument may place limits on the number of entities (single/multiple) selected or the type of entities (player/any entity) selected.Official examplesPlayer0123@e@e[type=foo]dd12be42-52a9-4a91-a8a1-11c01849e498JSON properties in command syntax output[NBT Compound / JSON Object] properties: The root properties object.[String] amount: The amount of entities that can be selected. Can be single or multiple.[String] type: The target entity type. Can be players or entities.minecraft:entity_anchor[edit | edit source]Must be either eyes or feet.Official exampleseyesfeetminecraft:float_range[edit | edit source]Must be a range acceptable for single-precision floating-point values. (e.g. 0.1 - exact match of 0.1. ..0.1 - less than or equal to 0.1. 0.1.. - more than or equal to 0.1. 0.1..1 - from 0.1 to 1, both inclusive.)Note: Although the float range argument type is present, it is not used by Minecraft.Official examples0..5.20-5.4-100.76....100minecraft:function[edit | edit source]It must be a resource location or one prefixed with a #, which resolves into a function or a function tag during command execution.Official examplesfoofoo:bar#foominecraft:game_profile[edit | edit source]Specifies one or more game profiles (player profiles). Must be a player name (should be a real one if the server is in online mode) or a player-type target selector.Official examplesPlayer0123dd12be42-52a9-4a91-a8a1-11c01849e498@eminecraft:gamemode[edit | edit source]Must be one of the following:survival for Survival modecreative for Creative modeadventure for Adventure modespectator for Spectator modeNote that "hardcore" is not a valid option, as it is technically not a game mode.Official examplessurvivalcreativeminecraft:heightmap[edit | edit source]Must be one of world_surface, motion_blocking, motion_blocking_no_leaves, and ocean_floor.Official examplesworld_surfaceocean_floorminecraft:int_range[edit | edit source]Must be a range acceptable for 32-bit integer values. (e.g. 0 - exact match of 0. ..0 - less than or equal to 0. 0.. - more than or equal to 0. 0..1 - from 0 to 1, both inclusive.)Official examples0..50-5-100....100minecraft:item_predicate[edit | edit source]The format of item_predicate parameters is <item_type>[<list of tests>], in which the list of tests with [] can be omitted when not needed.<item_type> is required.It can be in the format of resource location (if namespace isn't set it defaults to minecraft:).It can also be the resource location of a block tag or item tag with the prefix of #, such as #minecraft:planks.It can also be a wildcard character * to match any item type.The list of tests is optional. Test entries are inside [] and separated with <separator>.A test entry can be:<component_id> - Checks if a component exists.<component_id> is the ID of a data component.<component_id>=<value> - Matches exact value of a component.<value> is a representation of component value in SNBT format.<predicate_id>~<value> - Checks an item sub-predicate<predicate_id> is the ID of an item sub-predicate.<value> is a representation of item sub-predicate in SNBT format.Example: *[damage~{durability:{min:3}}] matches any stack with at least 3 uses left.minecraft:count -  Matches the stack size.count - Always passes.count=<positive_int> - Passes only when the stack size equals to the given value.count~<positive_int> - Passes only when the stack size equals to the given value.count~<int_range> - Passes when the stack size is in the specified range.<int_range> is an SNBT of {min:<min value>, max:<max value>}. Both min and max are optional.Example: *[count~{max:2}] matches any stack with count <= 2.Any test entry above can be negated by prefixing with !.Example: *[!count=1] matches any stack that has count other than 1.A <separator> can be:| - Logical OR., - Logical AND.Unlike most programming languages, the precedence of | (Logical OR) is higher than , (Logical AND).That means tests entries joined with | are treated as a single entry to check multiple alternatives.Example: *[!damage|damage=0, count=1] looks for items without damage component or with 0 damage, and its count must be 1.Official examplesstickminecraft:stick#stickminecraft:item_slot[edit | edit source]Must be a string notation that refer to a single slot in the inventory, which consists of "slot type" and optional "slot number", in the format of <slot_type> or <slot_type>.<slot_number>. See Slot for details.Official examplescontainer.5weaponminecraft:item_slots[edit | edit source]Must be a string notation that refer to certain slot(s) in the inventory, which consists of "slot type" and optional "slot number", in the format of <slot_type> or <slot_type>.<slot_number>. Wildcard (*) is accepted. See Slot for details.Official examplescontainer.*container.5weaponminecraft:item_stack[edit | edit source]The format of item_stack is <item_id>[<list of components>], in which the list of components with [] can be omitted when not needed.<item_id> is required, and it should be in the format of resource location (if namespace isn't set it defaults to minecraft:).The list of data components is optional. Data component entries are inside [] separated with ,.A data component entry can be:<component_id>=<value> - Sets value of a data component.<component_id> is the ID of a data component.<value> is a representation of component value in SNBT format.!<component_id> - Removes a default data component of the item.When giving items, any components provided are set or removed, but anything omitted retain their default values, depending on the item type.Official examplesstickminecraft:stickstick{foo:bar} [sic]minecraft:loot_modifier[edit | edit source]Specifies a item modifier with a resource location or in SNBT format. Must be a valid item modifier definition in SNBT format, or a resource location of an existing item modifier (an entry in minecraft:item_modifier registry). For NBT tag, if it is a string tag, the tag is also parsed into a resource location and resolved into an existing item modifier; otherwise, the tag is parsed as a new item modifier definition.Official examples foo: bar{function: set_components, components: {"!damage": {}}}{function: set_count, count: 10, add: true}minecraft:loot_predicate[edit | edit source]Specifies a predicate with a resource location or in SNBT format. Must be a valid predicate definition in SNBT format, or a resource location of an existing predicate (an entry in minecraft:predicate registry). For NBT tag, if it is a string tag, the tag is also parsed into a resource location and resolved into an existing predicate; otherwise, the tag is parsed as a new predicate definition.Official examples foo: bar{condition:weather_check, raining:true}{condition:random_chance, chance: 0.5}minecraft:loot_table[edit | edit source]Specifies a loot table with a resource location or in SNBT format. Must be a valid loot table definition in SNBT format, or a resource location of an existing loot table (an entry in minecraft:loot_table registry). For NBT tag, if it is a string tag, the tag is also parsed into a resource location and resolved into an existing loot table; otherwise, the tag is parsed as a new loot table definition.Official examples foo: bar{pools: [{rolls: 2, entries: [{type: item, weight: 1, name: stick}, {type: item, weight: 1, name: blaze_rod}]}]}minecraft:message[edit | edit source]It is a greedy phrase string argument (taking the rest of the command as the string argument). Can include spaces as well as target selectors. The game replaces entity selectors in the message with the list of selected entities' names, which is formatted as "name1 and name2" for two entities, or "name1, name2, ... and namen" for n entities.Official examplesHello world!foo@eHello @p :)minecraft:nbt_compound_tag[edit | edit source]Must be a [NBT Compound / JSON Object] compound NBT in SNBT format.Official examples{}{foo:bar}minecraft:nbt_path[edit | edit source]Must be an NBT path.An examplefoo.bar[0]."A [crazy name]".baz.foobar<the first list element>A [crazy name]baz<the second list element>Official examplesfoofoo.barfoo[0][0][]{foo:bar}minecraft:nbt_tag[edit | edit source]Must be an NBT tag of any type in SNBT format.Official examples00b0xFF0.0"foo"{foo:bar}minecraft:objective[edit | edit source]It must be a single word. (Allowed characters include: -, +, ., _, A-Z, a-z, and 0-9) It resolves into a scoreboard objective during command execution.Official examplesfoo*012minecraft:objective_criteria[edit | edit source]Must be a scoreboard objective criterion.Official examplesfoofoo.bar.bazminecraft:foominecraft:operation[edit | edit source]Must be an arithmetic operator for /scoreboard.Valid values include = (assignment), += (addition), -= (subtraction), *= (multiplication), /= (floor division), %= (modulus), >< (swapping), < (choosing minimum) and > (choosing maximum).Official examples=><minecraft:particle[edit | edit source]It must be in the format of particle_type_id{configuration tags} for particle types with configurations, or the format of particle_type_id for particle types without configurations.Official examplesfoofoo:barparticle with optionsminecraft:resource[edit | edit source]Must be an existing registered resource location in correct registry.Official examplesfoofoo:bar012JSON properties in command syntax output[NBT Compound / JSON Object] properties: The root properties object.[String] registry: The registry ID.minecraft:resource_key[edit | edit source]Must be a resource location, which resolves during command execution into a registry entry in correct registry.Official examplesfoofoo:bar012JSON properties in command syntax output[NBT Compound / JSON Object] properties: The root properties object.[String] registry: The registry ID.minecraft:resource_location[edit | edit source]Must be a resource location for an unregistered content. It is resolved during command execution into the unregistered content, or sent to the client to resolve into a client-side content.Official examplesfoofoo:bar012minecraft:resource_or_tag[edit | edit source]Must be an existing registered resource location or tag in correct registry.Official examplesfoofoo:bar012#skeletons#minecraft:skeletonsJSON properties in command syntax output[NBT Compound / JSON Object] properties: The root properties object.[String] registry: The registry ID.minecraft:resource_or_tag_key[edit | edit source]Must be a resource location or a tag, which resolves during command execution into an entry or tag in correct registry.Official examplesfoofoo:bar012#skeletons#minecraft:skeletonsJSON properties in command syntax output[NBT Compound / JSON Object] properties: The root properties object.[String] registry: The registry ID.minecraft:resource_selector[edit | edit source]Similar to resouce_location except enables the use of wildcard characters.* - matches from 0 to any number of characters? - matches exactly one characterOfficial examples*:* - matches all IDs* - matches everthing in the minecraft namespacecustom:folder/*_test_? - matches IDs in the folder subfolder in the custom namespace that end in _test_ followed by one additional character.minecraft:rotation[edit | edit source]Must be a rotation consisting of two double number elements, including yaw and pitch, measured in degrees.For the horizontal rotation (yaw), -180.0 for due north, -90.0 for due east, 0.0 for due south, 90.0 for due west, to 179.9 for just west of due north, before wrapping back around to -180.0.For the vertical rotation (pitch), -90.0 for straight up to 90.0 for straight down.Tilde notation can be used to specify a rotation relative to the execution rotation.Official examples0 0~ ~~-5 ~5minecraft:score_holder[edit | edit source]It must be either a target selector, a player name, a UUID, or * for all score holders being tracked by the scoreboard system. Player names don't need to be of a player that is online or a player that exists and can use almost all unicode characters​[more information needed].Each score holder argument may specify if it can select only one score holder or multiple score holders.Examples#hidden.topOfficial examplesPlayer0123*@eJSON properties in command syntax output[NBT Compound / JSON Object] properties: The root properties object.[String] amount: The amount of score holders that can be selected. Can be single or multiple.minecraft:scoreboard_slot[edit | edit source]Must be a scoreboard display slot.Official examplessidebarfoo.barminecraft:style[edit | edit source]Must contain style information for text component.Official examples{"bold": true}minecraft:swizzle[edit | edit source]Any non-repeating combination of the characters 'x', 'y', and 'z'. Axes can be declared in any order, but they cannot duplicate. (For example, x, xz, zyx, or yz.)Official examplesxyzxminecraft:team[edit | edit source]Must be an unquoted string, which resolves into a team during command execution. Allowed characters include: -, +, ., _, A-Z, a-z, and 0-9.Official examplesfoo123minecraft:template_mirror[edit | edit source]Must be one of none, front_back, and left_right.Official examplesnoneleft_rightminecraft:template_rotation[edit | edit source]Must be one of none, clockwise_90, counterclockwise_90, and 180.Official examplesnoneclockwise_90minecraft:time[edit | edit source]It must be a single-precision floating-point number suffixed with a unit. It must be not less than 0 gameticks. Units include:d: an in-game day, 24000 gameticks;s: a second, 20 gameticks;t (default and omitable): a single gametick; the default unit.The time is set to the closest integer after unit conversion to gametick. For example. .5d is same as 12000 gameticks.Official examples0d0s0t0JSON properties in command syntax output[NBT Compound / JSON Object] properties: The root properties object.[Int] min: The minimum time in game ticks.minecraft:uuid[edit | edit source]Must be a UUID in the hyphenated hexadecimal format. Allowed characters include: -, A-F、, a-f, and 0-9.Note: Although the UUID argument type is present, it is not used by Minecraft.Official examplesdd12be42-52a9-4a91-a8a1-11c01849e498minecraft:vec2[edit | edit source]Must be two-dimensional coordinates with double-precision floating-point number elements. Accepts tilde notations.Official examples0 0~ ~0.1 -0.5~1 ~-2minecraft:vec3[edit | edit source]Must be three-dimensional coordinates with double-precision floating-point number elements. Accepts tilde and caret notations.Official examples0 0 0~ ~ ~^ ^ ^^1 ^ ^-50.1 -0.5 .9~0.5 ~1 ~-5Removed[edit | edit source]minecraft:entity_summon[edit | edit source]Must be a resource location of a summonable entity type.Official examplesminecraft:pigcowminecraft:item_enchantment[edit | edit source]Must be an ID of an enchantment.Official examplesunbreakingsilk_touchminecraft:mob_effect[edit | edit source]Must be an ID of a status effect.Official examplesspookyeffectBedrock Edition[edit | edit source]  This section needs to be updated. Please update this section to reflect recent updates or newly available information.BlockStateCommandParam[edit | edit source]Also known as BLOCK_STATE_ARRAY.Must be a blockstate argument as ["<state1>"=<value1>,"<state2>"=<value2>,...]. For example: ["old_leaf_type"="birch","persistent_bit"=true].CommandCompareOperator[edit | edit source]Also known as COMPAREOPERATOR.Must be one of <, <=, =, >=, and >.CommandFilePath[edit | edit source]Also known as PATHCOMMAND. It must be of the format path/to/function/file, which resolves into a function located at [behavior_pack]/functions/path/to/function/file.mcfunction during command execution.CommandIntegerRange[edit | edit source]Also known as FULLINTEGERRANGE.Must be a range acceptable for 32-bit integer values. (e.g. 0 - exact match of 0. ..0 - less than or equal to 0. 0.. - more than or equal to 0. 0..1 - from 0 to 1, both inclusive.)CommandMessage[edit | edit source]Also known as MESSAGE_ROOT.It is a greedy phrase string argument (taking the rest of the command as the string argument). Can include spaces as well as target selectors. The game replaces entity selectors in the message with the list of selected entities' names, which is formatted as "name1 and name2" for two entities, or "name1, name2, ... and namen" for n entities.@<player name> can be used to mention a player; @here can be used to mention all players.CommandOperator[edit | edit source]Also known as OPERATOR.Must be an arithmetic operator for /scoreboard.Valid values include = (assignment), += (addition), -= (subtraction), *= (multiplication), /= (floor division), %= (modulus), >< (swapping), < (choosing minimum) and > (choosing maximum).CommandPosition[edit | edit source]Also known as POSITION.Must be a three-dimensional coordinates composed of <X>, <Y> and <Z>, each of which must be a single-precision floating-point number or tilde and caret notation.CommandPositionFloat[edit | edit source]Also known as POSITION_FLOAT.Must be three-dimensional coordinates with single-precision floating-point number elements. Accepts tilde and caret notations.CommandRawText[edit | edit source]Also known as RAWTEXT.It is a greedy phrase string argument (taking the rest of the command as the string argument).CommandSelector<Actor> and CommandSelector<Player>[edit | edit source]Also known as SELECTION.CommandSelector<Actor> is used to specify entities. Must be a player name or a target selector. CommandSelector<Player> is used to specify players. Must be a player name or a target selector. CommandWildcardInt[edit | edit source]Also known as WILDCARDINT.Must be a 32-bit integer, or a asterisk (*) to represent MIN_INT(-2,147,483,648),float[edit | edit source]Also known as VAL.Must be a [Float]Single-precision floating-point number (from -(2-2-23)×2127 (≈-3.4×1038) to (2-2-23)2×127 (≈3.4×1038) ).int[edit | edit source]Also known as INT.Must be a [Int]32-bit integer number (from -2147483648 (-231) to 2147483647 (231-1) ).Json::Value[edit | edit source]Also known as JSON_OBJECT.It must be a JSON [NBT Compound / JSON Object]Object.RelativeFloat[edit | edit source]Also known as RVAL.Must be a [Float] float. Accepts tilde notation.std::basic_string[edit | edit source]Also known as ID.Must be a string. And it must be a single word that has no space or a double-quoted string (When quoted, \ can be used to escape characters).std::unique_ptr<Command>[edit | edit source]Also known as SLASHCOMMAND.Represents a complete command.WildcardCommandSelector<Actor>[edit | edit source]Also known as WILDCARDSELECTION.It must be either a target selector, a player name, a unique ID of an entity, or * for all score holders being tracked by the scoreboard system. Player names don't need to be of a player that is online or a player that exists and can use almost all unicode characters​[more information needed].Enum[edit | edit source]Must be an unquoted string without space.History[edit | edit source]Java Edition1.1317w45aCommand arguments are now handled with Brigadier.1.1419w08aNow allows single quotes for strings in commands.[1]1.1620w17aAdded minecraft:uuid argument type.1.16.220w29aAdded angle arguments to /spawnpoint and /setworldspawn, with a argument type that is not registered.[2]20w30aAdded minecraft:angle argument type.Now /spawnpoint and /setworldspawn use this argument type.[2]?Now minecraft:dimension argument type checks whether the dimension exists during execution instead of parsing.1.1720w45aNow minecraft:angle argument type does not accept NaN or Infinite.[3]21w10aNow minecraft:block_pos arguments in /spawnpoint and /setworldspawn require <x> and <z> to be in the range of [-30000000, 30000000), and <y> to be in the range of [-20000000, 20000000) when executing.[4]1.1821w37aRemoved 16-character limit in minecraft:objective argument type.[5]1.18.2Pre-release 3Added minecraft:resource and minecraft:resource_or_tag argument types.Now minecraft:resource_location is used only for pack contents, while minecraft:resource is used for registry entries.1.1922w11aNow minecraft:item_predicate and minecraft:block_predicate require tag to exist when parsing instead of executing.[6]22w19aAdded minecraft:template_mirror and minecraft:template_rotation argument types.1.19.322w42aAdded minecraft:resource_key and minecraft:resource_or_tag_key argument types, which are used for reloadable registry entries (i.e. registered pack contents).Now minecraft:resource and minecraft:resource_or_tag are used only for un-reloadable registry entries.Removed minecraft:mob_effect, minecraft:entity_summon and minecraft:item_enchantment argument types. question: What is a valid type of output in the Minecraft command syntax and What is the valid set of CommandCompareOperator values in the Bedrock Edition of Minecraft?
answer: A valid type of output in the Minecraft command syntax is a resource location or a tag, which is resolved during command execution into an entry or tag in the correct registry. In the Bedrock Edition of Minecraft, the valid set of CommandCompareOperator values is one of <, <=, =, >=, and >.
